definition: (lit. and fig.) to carry a heavy load/to carry a heavy burden
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence

sentences.english: What we Chinese do best, is to endure.
sentences.chinese: 中國人是最能忍辱負重的人民。

sentences.english: Poor Barry stopped a packet when his car was in collision with a lorry.
sentences.chinese: 巴里的車與一輛卡車相撞，可憐的巴里身負重傷。

sentences.english: Get plank brick this matter, if stem good, call to meekly tolerate insult negative heavy.
sentences.chinese: 挨板磚這事，如果幹得好，叫忍辱負重。

sentences.english: He received severe injuries and nearly lost his life during the Second World War.
sentences.chinese: 在第二次世界大戰期間他身負重傷險些喪命。

sentences.english: The newly developed jelly iron has reached international advanced standards.
sentences.chinese: 最新研製的負重軟鐵系列達到了國際領先水平。

sentences.english: Why do we have to live like this when we don't want to?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼人一定要忍辱負重地活着？

sentences.english: Degenerative osteoarthritis tends to occur on weight-bearing joints and afflicts life quality significantly.
sentences.chinese: 退化性關節炎好發於負重的關節，影響生活品質甚巨。

sentences.english: Here are the young men then, a weight on their shoulders, but love in their hearts.
sentences.chinese: 就是這羣年輕人，肩負重任，心懷夢想。

sentences.english: The action of two core elements of the power load weight and movement speed.
sentences.chinese: 動作功率兩個核心要素是負重重量和動作速度。

sentences.english: Our future life is an important power, is called a humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 我們未來生活的一種重要能力，叫做忍辱負重的能力。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the strain of the weight-bearing metatarsal bone.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討完整狀態下站立負重時足跖骨的應變。

sentences.english: Press the weights straight overhead, keeping your wrists in the same position.
sentences.chinese: 推起負重超過頭頂，保持你的手腕在同一位置。

sentences.english: He is shouldering heavy debt for his child's education.
sentences.chinese: 爲了讓孩子受教育，他身負重債。

sentences.english: Ability to grasp , lift and carry or otherwise move packages , boxes and luggage up to 100lbs . continuously throughout shift .
sentences.chinese: 有一定負重能力，能在當值期間持續搬運行李和重物。

sentences.english: Imperial search teams found Dodonna's wounded body and took the officer captive.
sentences.chinese: 帝國搜索隊找到身負重傷的多登納，俘虜了這位軍官。

sentences.english: Despite his terrible injuries, he wouldn't give up the struggle for life.
sentences.chinese: 他儘管身負重傷，但仍然沒有放棄求生的努力。

definition: to toughen/to temper/to engage in physical exercise/to work out/(fig.) to develop one's skills/to train oneself
to walk around/to move about/to stretch one's legs/to go for a walk/to be mobile (e.g. after an illness)/to visit one another/to pay a visit (go to the toilet)
to bear/to carry on one's back/to shoulder
